org.openmarl.susrv

Class LibSusrv

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openmarl.susrv.LibSusrv

  • public class LibSusrv
extends Object
    Represents the direct native libsusrv.so API exported through JNI.

    This API is specified by jni/su_srv.h.

    Author:
    t0kt0ckus

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int INVALID_RESULT_ERR
      Denotes a situation when a command string execution aborted abnormally, before providing its result code.
      static int NO_SESSION_ERR
      Denotes a situation when one attempts to execute a command string though no SU Shell session is currently bound to the requesting process.
      static int SESSION_EXISTS_ERR
      Denotes a situation where a SU Shell session is already bound to the requesting process, and no additional session can be opened.
      static int SYS_ERR
      Denotes an undetermined system level error.

    • Field Detail

      • SYS_ERR

        public static final int SYS_ERR
        Denotes an undetermined system level error.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SESSION_EXISTS_ERR

        public static final int SESSION_EXISTS_ERR
        Denotes a situation where a SU Shell session is already bound to the requesting process, and no additional session can be opened. This may not be an actual error.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NO_SESSION_ERR

        public static final int NO_SESSION_ERR
        Denotes a situation when one attempts to execute a command string though no SU Shell session is currently bound to the requesting process.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INVALID_RESULT_ERR

        public static final int INVALID_RESULT_ERR
        Denotes a situation when a command string execution aborted abnormally, before providing its result code.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • openShellSession

        public static int openShellSession(String pfsRoot)
        Opens the SU shell session bound to the requesting process. If no session's currently bound, a new one is initialized.

        On success, the created shell is bound to the requesting process until exitShellSession() is called, or the shell process abnormally dies.

        This API si specified by the C function su_srv_open_shell_sesssion().

        Parameters:
        pfsRoot - The private filesystem root absolute path.
        Returns:
        0 on success, SESSION_EXISTS_ERR, SYS_ERR, or a C/POSIX error code on error.

      • exec

        public static int exec(String cmd)
        Executes a command within the shell session currently bound to the requesting process.

        This API si specified by the C function su_srv_exec().

        Parameters:
        cmd - The command string to execute.
        Returns:
        NO_SESSION_ERR, INVALID_RESULT_ERR, or the (should be non-negative, or at least > -1) command exit code.

      • ping

        public static int ping()
        Answers whether the requesting process is currently bound to a shell session.

        This API si specified by the C function su_srv_ping().

        Returns:
        A non-0 value when the requesting process is currently not bound to any shell session.

      • getLastTtyRead

        public static String getLastTtyRead()
        Answers the last line read on the current session "terminal" output.
        Returns:
        The las shell output line, or null when not available.

      • getpid

        public static int getpid(String procname)
        Answers the PID of the first process which name matches a search term.

        This API si specified by the C function su_srv_getpid().

        Parameters:
        procname - The process name to search for, for example com.android.phone.
        Returns:
        A non-negative process PID (should also be > 0), or a negative number when no process found with the given name.

      • exitShellSession

        public static int exitShellSession()
        Exits the shell session currently bound to the requiring process.

        This releases all associated native resources (process, thread, socket, ...). Any further attempt to call exec(String) will obviously fail.

        This API si specified by the C function su_srv_exit_shell_sesssion().

        Returns:
        00 success, NO_SESSION_ERR, SYS_ERR, or a C/POSIX error code when failed to properly close the current session.
